intro: Aquilicia, commonly known as the common thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple or pink flowers that bloom in composite flower heads. These plants are typically found in temperate regions and are often found in dry, rocky soils. Aquilicia species are known for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional herbal remedies. They play an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
